llm_text:
Why:
The model flag is driven primarily by payment_format_ach (value=1) which strongly increased the score (SHAP=+2.92227). Large transaction size contributed: amount_received (14222.2) increased risk (SHAP=+1.05686) and amount_paid (14222.2) also increased risk (SHAP=+0.69309). Timing also raised the score: dayofweek (value=6, i.e., Sunday) increased the score (SHAP=+0.59246). Offsetting effects were smaller: from_bank (225215) slightly decreased the score (SHAP=-0.37123) and receiving_currency_euro (value=1) had a small negative effect (SHAP=-0.14556).

Conclusion:
The alert is mainly due to ACH payment method and high, equal paid/received amounts executed on dayofweek=6. The sending bank and euro currency modestly reduced the model score. If ACH transfers of this size on Sundays are expected for this customer, the risk driver may be explainable; otherwise these feature combinations justify further review.
